item.title: Larry add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Larry add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Larry add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Larry add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Larry add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Larry add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Larry add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Larry add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Larry add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Larry add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Larry add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Larry add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Larry add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Larry add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Larry add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Larry add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Larry add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Larry add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Peace begins with a smile.." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Larry add a quote by Daphne Rae
item.description: "I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love." -- Daphne Rae

item.title: Larry add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: Larry add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Larry add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Larry add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Larry add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Larry add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble. Matthew 6:34" -- Anonymous
